events.name: Car bombing kills daughter of Putin ally
events.wd_label: Car bombing kills daughter of Putin ally
events.wd_description: Darya Dugina, the daughter of prominent ultra-nationalist ideologue Alexander Dugin, was killed in a suspected car bombing outside Moscow. Her father, a close ally of Vladimir Putin, was believed to be the intended target.
events.description: Darya Dugina, the daughter of prominent ultra-nationalist ideologue Alexander Dugin, was killed in a suspected car bombing outside Moscow. Her father, a close ally of Vladimir Putin, was believed to be the intended target.

events.name: car bombing
events.wd_description: An explosive device planted under the car went off, causing the vehicle to catch fire and killing Darya Dugina.
events.description: An explosive device planted under the car went off, causing the vehicle to catch fire and killing Darya Dugina.

events.name: Alexander Dugin's connection to Putin
events.wd_description: Alexander Dugin, known as "Putin's brain," is a prominent ultra-nationalist ideologue with a close relationship with the Russian President.
events.description: Alexander Dugin, known as "Putin's brain," is a prominent ultra-nationalist ideologue with a close relationship with the Russian President.

events.name: investigation by Russian authorities
events.wd_description: Russian forensic and explosive experts are investigating the incident, confirming that Darya Dugina died after the explosion.
events.description: Russian forensic and explosive experts are investigating the incident, confirming that Darya Dugina died after the explosion.

events.name: Ukrainian response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian official Mykhailo Podolyak dismissed accusations of Ukraine's involvement, stating that Ukraine is not a criminal state.
events.description: Ukrainian official Mykhailo Podolyak dismissed accusations of Ukraine's involvement, stating that Ukraine is not a criminal state.

events.name: Flood and Humanitarian Crisis in Pakistan
events.wd_label: Flood and Humanitarian Crisis in Pakistan
events.wd_description: The intense monsoon season in Pakistan led to severe flooding, resulting in a humanitarian crisis with widespread displacement, significant loss of life, and damage to agriculture.
events.description: The intense monsoon season in Pakistan led to severe flooding, resulting in a humanitarian crisis with widespread displacement, significant loss of life, and damage to agriculture.

events.name: Intense Monsoon
events.wd_description: The World Meteorological Organization reported an unusually intense monsoon season in Pakistan and northwest India, with some areas in Sindh receiving over 1,288 millimeters of rain in August.
events.description: The World Meteorological Organization reported an unusually intense monsoon season in Pakistan and northwest India, with some areas in Sindh receiving over 1,288 millimeters of rain in August.

events.name: Flooding and Casualties
events.wd_description: The flooding caused by the monsoon has been described as the worst disaster in Pakistan's history, with 1,100 deaths, 2,600 injuries, and millions displaced, along with significant agricultural losses.
events.description: The flooding caused by the monsoon has been described as the worst disaster in Pakistan's history, with 1,100 deaths, 2,600 injuries, and millions displaced, along with significant agricultural losses.

events.name: Government and UN Response
events.wd_description: The Pakistani government is conducting rescue operations, while the United Nations launched a $116 million campaign to support flood victims.
events.description: The Pakistani government is conducting rescue operations, while the United Nations launched a $116 million campaign to support flood victims.

events.name: School shooting in Izhevsk, Russia
events.wd_description: A gunman opened fire at a school in Izhevsk, central Russia, killing at least 15 people and injuring 24, including 11 children. The gunman, a former student of the school, killed himself at the scene.
events.description: A gunman opened fire at a school in Izhevsk, central Russia, killing at least 15 people and injuring 24, including 11 children. The gunman, a former student of the school, killed himself at the scene.

events.name: casualties
events.wd_description: Eleven children and four adults, including two security guards and two teachers, were killed in the shooting, and 24 others were injured, with only two of them not being children.
events.description: Eleven children and four adults, including two security guards and two teachers, were killed in the shooting, and 24 others were injured, with only two of them not being children.

events.name: panic inside the school
events.wd_description: Video footage showed panic inside the building, with children and adults running along the corridors and blood seen on the floor of a classroom, with children crouching underneath desks.
events.description: Video footage showed panic inside the building, with children and adults running along the corridors and blood seen on the floor of a classroom, with children crouching underneath desks.

events.name: details of the incident
events.wd_description: The gunman, a former student of the school, opened fire at the school with about 1,000 pupils in the city of Izhevsk and then killed himself at the scene.
events.description: The gunman, a former student of the school, opened fire at the school with about 1,000 pupils in the city of Izhevsk and then killed himself at the scene.

events.name: Global EV battery supply chain requirements
events.wd_label: Global EV battery supply chain requirements
events.wd_description: To meet the demand for EV and energy storage batteries by 2035, the world needs to build almost 400 new mines for key battery components, according to Benchmark Minerals.
events.description: To meet the demand for EV and energy storage batteries by 2035, the world needs to build almost 400 new mines for key battery components, according to Benchmark Minerals.

events.name: increasing demand
events.wd_description: The need for lithium-ion batteries is expected to grow six times by 2032, driving significant demand for key raw materials.
events.description: The need for lithium-ion batteries is expected to grow six times by 2032, driving significant demand for key raw materials.

events.name: growth projections
events.wd_description: Benchmark predicts a sixfold increase in the need for lithium-ion batteries by 2032.
events.description: Benchmark predicts a sixfold increase in the need for lithium-ion batteries by 2032.

events.name: key materials
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries require graphite, lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are in limited supply.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries require graphite, lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are in limited supply.

events.name: new mines required
events.wd_description: Almost 400 new mines for lithium, graphite, nickel, and cobalt are needed by 2035 to meet battery demand, reducing slightly with recycling efforts.
events.description: Almost 400 new mines for lithium, graphite, nickel, and cobalt are needed by 2035 to meet battery demand, reducing slightly with recycling efforts.

events.name: lithium mines
events.wd_description: The world needs 74 new lithium mines, which can be reduced to 59 with recycling contributions.
events.description: The world needs 74 new lithium mines, which can be reduced to 59 with recycling contributions.

events.name: graphite mines
events.wd_description: 97 natural flake graphite mines are required by 2035, assuming no recycling contributions.
events.description: 97 natural flake graphite mines are required by 2035, assuming no recycling contributions.

events.name: nickel mines
events.wd_description: 72 new nickel mining projects are required by 2035.
events.description: 72 new nickel mining projects are required by 2035.

events.name: cobalt mines
events.wd_description: Without recycling, 62 new cobalt mining projects are needed by 2035.
events.description: Without recycling, 62 new cobalt mining projects are needed by 2035.

events.name: challenges and concerns
events.wd_description: Limited supplies of key materials and reliance on China for battery components pose geopolitical and ethical challenges.
events.description: Limited supplies of key materials and reliance on China for battery components pose geopolitical and ethical challenges.

events.name: China's dominance
events.wd_description: China controls the majority of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, producing 80% of batteries and refining key materials.
events.description: China controls the majority of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, producing 80% of batteries and refining key materials.

events.name: ethical concerns
events.wd_description: Ethical issues include alleged labor and human rights violations in China and environmental concerns in Chile and Argentina.
events.description: Ethical issues include alleged labor and human rights violations in China and environmental concerns in Chile and Argentina.

events.name: mining challenges
events.wd_description: Establishing new mines is time-consuming and subject to regulatory challenges, particularly in the US.
events.description: Establishing new mines is time-consuming and subject to regulatory challenges, particularly in the US.

events.name: innovative solutions
events.wd_description: Startups and new technologies are emerging to address battery supply chain challenges and improve sustainability.
events.description: Startups and new technologies are emerging to address battery supply chain challenges and improve sustainability.

events.name: Aceleron’s lithium batteries
events.wd_description: Aceleron produces lithium batteries designed to be easily upgraded and extended, enhancing their lifecycle.
events.description: Aceleron produces lithium batteries designed to be easily upgraded and extended, enhancing their lifecycle.

events.name: Tesla’s potential mining
events.wd_description: Tesla may enter the lithium mining and refining business due to high material costs.
events.description: Tesla may enter the lithium mining and refining business due to high material costs.
